text:
Moravian Cemetery (Staten Island): A view of the Vanderbilt Mausoleum near the north end of the cemetery. It was built by William H. Vanderbilt; and there he is buried. The cemetery is on the north side of Richmond Road, at its juncture with Todt Hill Road.

About 1905

By Mulford Simonson
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P.L. Sperr.
title: Cemeteries - Moravian Cemetery - Staten Island

text:
(1) Moravian Cemetery (Staten Island): New Dorp Moravian Church. A view of the church, within the cemetery grounds, that was erected in 1845, having replaced the original church, consecrated in 1763. The edifice is about 55 yards back of Richmond Road, at its junction with Todt Hill Road, near the entrance to the cemetery. The view is north.

Spring 1924

P. L. Sperr

(2) The same, at a later date,

P. L. Sperr
title: Cemeteries - Moravian Cemetery - Staten Island - [New Dorp Moravian Church.]

original_title: Richmond: Todt Hill Road - Richmond Road
text:
Todt Hill Road, east side, between Richmond Road and Flagg Place. Beer's 1874 map indicates the house to have belonged to Mrs. J. Fountain. Maps from 1898 to 1917 show it to have been within the bounds of the Moravian Cemetery.

April 22, 1932
P.L. Sperr
